intro: Leptodactylon pungens subsp. hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's spurge, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences. It is typically found in coastal and lowland areas, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
